page.title: 17ATTITUDES in Welwyn G.C.
page.content: Questionaires distributed to a selection of households suggest the following attitudes.{Religion}is very important to a few and most believe it to be fairly important. Just over half attend a place of worship occasionally and about half think that{church} {buildings}should be used for a much wider range of activities. National {politics}are very important to just over half and most of the others think that it is fairly important. Less than a quarter think that 'party' politics should be a part of local government. {Local Government}is thought to be adequate by the majority but nearly a quarter think that it is out of touch with local needs. Questions on{Social} {Concerns}show a need for more help for the elderly; general satisfaction with planning, youth and transport; little need for more recreational facilities.
